revised_title: Observations on the Anatomy of the Thyroid Body in Man
tldr: This article discusses the anatomy and development of the thyroid gland in humans. The author examines the thyroid's connections to the trachea and larynx during fetal development and concludes that it is developed in connection with the air-tube and has no relation to the thymus gland. The thyroid does not consist of two separate lateral masses, and the isthmus is present from the first as a distinct central portion. The pyramid is an outlying part of the body, presenting various shapes and sites during fetal life.
